name: Red Chillies (Fresh)
properties: Fresh red chillies (ripened version of green chillies)
Contains capsaicin, the compound responsible for heat
Rich in vitamin C (higher than citrus fruits)
Good source of vitamin A and beta-carotene
Heat level varies by variety (from mild to very hot)
Can be de-seeded to reduce heat while keeping flavor
More complex flavor than dried chilli powder
benefits: Boosts metabolism through thermogenic effect of capsaicin
May increase fat burning and reduce appetite
Supports immune function with high vitamin C content
Adds intense flavor without calories or sodium
May help clear congestion and support respiratory health
synergies: Essential component of red curry paste with lemongrass and turmeric
Pairs with ginger and garlic in Asian sauces
Combines with shallots in curry bases
Works with lemon juice for bright, spicy flavor
conflicts: Can irritate sensitive digestive systems - start with small amounts
Remove seeds and membranes to reduce heat
Wash hands after handling or use gloves
amount: 2 red chillies (de-stemmed and de-seeded) per curry paste recipe, adjust to taste

quotes: 2 red chillies, or more, to taste, de-stemmed and de-seeded
